intro: Trigonostemon verticillatus, commonly known as the spiralleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves around the stem. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
